alert.note: Alert for Eastern Windham (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 8:29PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Windham County through 900 PM EDT... At 828 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Brattleboro, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rain could also produce minor flooding in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Brattleboro, Putney, Vernon, Guilford, North Vernon, East Dummerston, Dummerston Center, West Brattleboro, Putney Station, West Dummerston, Naulahka and Fairview Village. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
